characters: STREET. IF YOU'RE NOT BACK AT BASE IN 24 HOURS, YOU ARE O
FOUR. IF YOU'RE NOT BACK AT BASE IN 24 HOURS, YOU ARE OUT
UNDER THE MATTRESS IN THE MASTER BEDROOM AT 188 CAHILLA
STOP HIM FROM SAVING ENGLAND. EVERYBODY DESERVES A CHANCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fade up on a yellow WALKMAN, and hear Deee-Lite’s “Gro is in the Heart”. It belongs to A GUARD practicing his dance moves outside remote MOORISH PALACE. ANOTHER GUARD is more chilled. Unt On the horizon: a HELICOPTER comes in fast and low, FOUR ARMED MEN hanging from it, on ropes. They wear gas masks. The men shoot both Guards. Then they blow out the windows swing inside, expertly releasing from their ropes. Moments later, the palace windows BLOW OUT. Fire and smok billow. Through the comms, we hear, over gunshots:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Area secured... Eyes on the target... Target secured. We move in through a broken window to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four operatives, tying A TERRORIST to a chair. The fi operative performs a swift body check, then removes his g mask. This is JACK LINCOLN, 32, handsome, calm and assure Another man removes his mask. Late 20s, black, good-looki His code name is MERLIN. He nods respectfully to Jack. A second follows suit. Early 20s, white, well-groomed, oo aristocratic confidence. He’ll come to be known as LANCEL It takes a nudge from Merlin to prompt the third to remov his mask. This is LEE, 22 - rugged face, army haircut and strong London accent. He looks to Jack, apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Jack draws a GUN and addresses his captive in perfect Ara

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We know there's a second attack planned today. I need the location. It‘ll take five shots to take you beyond repa so I suggest you answer quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response. Jack shoots him swiftly in both legs. Terrorist screams and slumps forward.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s two. You don't want to find out where I'll put the third.  2. Jack aims for the Terrorist’s groin. The Terrorist sits u He's smiling. Between his teeth he holds: A GRENADE PIN. Without hesitation, Lee dives onto him, with a warning cr

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Grenade! It DETONATES. Lee and the Terrorist are killed instantly. Jack, Lancelot and Merlin are blown back by the force, bu thanks to Lee, they’re alive. They pick themselves up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit. I missed it. How did I fucking miss it?

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Time was of the essence, sir. Could have happened to any one of us.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If it had been one of the trainees, it would have been forgivable. Jack glances regretfully at Lee. Then gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where does this leave us, Merlin?

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Lee was the stronger candidate, sir. As I believe he just made evident. But Hugo’s test performances have been flawless. Merlin indicates Lancelot. Jack extends his hand to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Welcome to Huntsman.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. TAXI/COUNCIL ESTATE
dialogues.text: A bleak, run-down estate. A LONDON TAXI pulls up. No ordinary cab - the interior looks like a gentlemen’s c Jack sits with a dignified older gent, ARTHUR, 50s. Arthu gazes out of the window with a look of disgust.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Revolting place.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We won't be here long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still dispute whether we need to be here at all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: “Rules are rules.” That’s your motto, isn’t it, Arthur?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: The rules are for gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They’re for Huntsmen.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: And that young man wasn’t one.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not yet. But he behaved as much like a Huntsman as any of those smug elitists the others put forward for the job. If it weren't for him, I wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Is that what’s troubling you, Galahad? Or the fact that your little experiment failed?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With respect, Arthur —- you're a snob,

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: With respect? Jack opens the car door and climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The world is changing. There's a reason aristocrats developed weak chins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front room of a small but neatly-kept flat. On the wa is a large framed shopping-mall portrait: Lee in army uni with his wife, MICHELLH, 20s, and their little son, BGGSY

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: We very much regret that your husband's bravery can’t be publicly celebrated. I hope you understand. On the floor, Eggsy plays with POKEMON CARDS, desperately trying to ignore the conversation, determined not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I if you won‘t tell me anything? I didn’t even know he wasn’t with his squad -- Now we see Jack and Michelle, sitting close by. Jack hold out a beautiful MEDAL. She takes it, studies it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry I can’t say more. But I'd like to present you with this. It's a Guinevere Cross. Very rare, and to those who know what it is, very highly respected. (Michelle hands it back) I know it’s not much comfort. But -- See on the back here? That’s my number. AS a more concrete gesture of gratitude, I’d like to offer... Let’s call it a favour.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The nature of it is your choice. Just tell the operator “oxfords not brogues,” then I’ll know it’s you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Sorry, what? Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Someone well-placed to help. But I’m afraid I can offer only one favour. So you may want to save it for an emergency. Jack holds the medal out to her again. She just stares.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t need your help. I need my husband back. She gets up, walks to the door and opens it. Jack stands. looks at Eggsy, who stares doggedly at his cards. Jack la the medal on the Pokemon cards. Eggsy picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s your name, young man?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE EGGSY
dialogues.text: Eggsy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Take care of that, Eggsy. And take good care of your mother, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent CHALET nestled near a snowy forest. ARMED GUARDS linger outside. Under a CAPTION: “17 YEARS LATER”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lavish decor, at odds with its occupants -- a hooded MAN to an art deco chair, surrounded by FIVE GOONS. The BIGGEST GOON carefully removes the hood, revealing th prisoner. This is PROFESSOR ALAN SWANSON, 40s. There's ga tape over his mouth. The goon starts to gently peel it of

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GOON
dialogues.text: So sorry, Professor Swanson. Just a tiny bit more, I’m trying not to -- The tape is half off now. The goon tugs gingerly at it.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: For god's sake, just rip it off!

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GOON
dialogues.text: I’m under very strict instructions not to hurt you, but -- The goon complies, wincing. Swanson doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Look, you’ve made a mistake. I'ma university lecturer. I’ve got no money.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GOON
dialogues.text: God no, this isn’t about money. You're in no danger, our boss just wants to talk to you. He’s a fan.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Am I meant to find that reassuring?

dialogues.speaker: GOON
dialogues.text: Let me get you a drink. You're a whiskey man, right? Hey, Red? Can you get a selection of our finest single malts, please? Another Goon - RED - hustles out. Suddenly, Swanson’s expression shifts: first relief, then anger.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Wait, is this one of those prank TV shows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you'll have a drink, our boss will be here soon, he’1ll explain everything. Honestly, our whiskey selection? You will shit. We got a 1943 Dalmore that's just -- A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. The confused Goon goes to answer it. It's Lancelot. Late 30s now, and wearing an excellent sui he’s even more dashing and assured than in his youth.

dialogues.speaker: LANCELOT
dialogues.text: I suppose asking to borrow a bowl of sugar is a step too far? Before anyone has a chance to respond, Lancelot draws his WEAPON and shoots every goon in the room. Stone dead. LANCELOT? (CONT’D) Professor Swanson. I'm here to take you home.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: This... isn’t a TV show, is it. Behind him, Red re-enters carrying a TRAY of various rare malt whiskies. Seeing the carnage, he reaches for his gun But Lancelot spins around, shoots Red dead and lunges jus time to catch the tray in his free hand as Red crumples.

dialogues.speaker: LANCELOT
dialogues.text: 1943 Dalmore. It’d be a sin to spill any, don't you think? Suddenly there’s another KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Lancelot -- s holding the whiskey in one hand -- readies his weapon. Suddenly, from another room, a male figure cartwheels in unbelievable speed and agility. He wears a pair of paraly quality RUNNING BLADES. This is GAZELLE, 30s. Before he can react, Gazelle amputates Lancelot’s gun han with a graceful arc of one - apparently razor sharp - bla Lancelot drops the whiskey in shock. Gazelle catches it.. -.-And continues to hold it steadily throughout the brief intense fight that ensues. Lancelot gives it his best, bu he’s no match for Gazelle and his fearsome samurai runnin blades. The whiskey survives. Lancelot, alas, doesn’t. Swanson reacts in stunned shock. Gazelle casually strides away to answer the front door. It’s his boss, VALENTINE. He’s a Mark Zuckerberg type, 20 Valentine takes the whiskey, opens it and sniffs it happi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kind of welcome. Then, taking in the carnage, and Swanson’s haunted face, moves to a nearby counter where he pours two glasses. VALENTINE (CONT’D) Looks like Professor Swanson could use a drop, too. Gazelle slices the terrified Swanson’s ropes, freeing him Valentine heads over with the whiskey. He hands a glass t Swanson, apologetic, and then downs his own in one.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘ll never get used to bloodshed. Makes me very nervous. (awkward pause) Looks like we have that in common! (pausing for a laugh that doesn‘t come) Truly, I mean you no harm. I've read all your papers, watched all your interviews. Like, I adore you, and wanna help you and I am so sorry you had to witness all this violence due to our unwanted guest. I promise you, by the time I’ve found out who he works for, you and I will be best of friends. INT. EGGSY’S ROOM - NIGHT 7 The photograph we saw before of Lee and his family stands propped up against a wall. We can hear GUNFIRE. Eggsy, now 21 and looking like someone who’d mug you for phone, lounges on his bed, playing Call of Duty. From 0.s over the gunfire, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Eggsy! I said come here! With a sigh, Eggsy pauses the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy enters. The room is now dirty, dilapidated. Michell looks worn down, slovenly. She’s slumped on the couch, smoking, flanked by two shady men: DEAN, 42 and KENZIE, 2 A TODDLER in a sagging diaper wanders around aimlessly.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You got any Rizlas, love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Go and get us some, then.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Get ‘em yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oi. What‘ve I said about talking to Dean like that? Eggsy looks at Dean with distaste, then nods at Kenzie.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Three’s a crowd, innit. Why don’t Dean's poodle go? Dean stands up. He’s big, intimidating. He produces a TEN POUND NOTE from his pocket and forces it into Eggsy’s han

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Get your mum the Rizlas and some beers and I'l tell you what: while you're gone we’ll show her three can be good company. Eggsy struggles to control his impulse to deck Dean.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Give him twenty, Dean, then he can buy himself a drink and all. She whispers something in Dean’s ear. He smiles, pulls ou another tenner. Reluctantly, Eggsy takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheers, love. And do me a favour, can you take your sister? She’s doing my head in. Seething, Eggsy scoops up the toddler and storms out. EXT. COUNCIL BLOCK HALLWAY - NIGHT. Eggsy stands in a windy, graffitied walkway, stabbing at ELEVATOR BUTTON. In his arms, his sister begins to grizzl Eggsy takes off his hoodie and wraps it around her.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: That’s better, innit? He pushes the button again. Still nothing. Eggsy kicks th elevator door and heads for the urine-puddled stairwell.  10 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An identical cold, dirty walkway. Eggsy stands at the ope door to a flat talking to an elderly Indian lady, MRS JOS

dialogues.speaker: MRS JOSHI
dialogues.text: Oh come on Eggsy, not again.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I'll only be twenty minutes. She takes Eggsy’s sister. He kisses them both on the chee INT. PUB — NIGHT. 11 A grim pub. Eggsy sits in a corner drinking with two mate RYAN and JAMAL.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: If Dean treats your mum so bad why don't she leave him?

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Low self-esteem, that's her problem.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fuck off, why would she have low self-esteem? Eggsy’s mum’s fit. Eggsy’s not really listening. He stares into his pint.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: One of these days... I’m gonna smash his face in.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Are you mental, cuz? He'd just get that lot to do you and pretend he didn't know nothing about it. Without really thinking, Jamal points over at a bunch of GANG MEMBERS at a nearby table. They notice.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG BOY
dialogues.text: What you saying, blud?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANG BOY
dialogues.text: Think you can chat shit about us and we won't do nothing just cos our guvnor’s banging Eggsy’s mum?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Pretty much, yeah. The first boy stands up and walks over to the table. He l over Eggsy, huge. Eggsy’s mates freeze. Jamal hisses to h  12 13

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Leave it, fam. Let’s just go. They ain’t worth it. A tense stand off for a beat. Then Eggsy gets up and head for the door. His friends follow, relieved. The Gang JEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy, Ryan and Jamal swagger out, trying as hard as they not to look like they‘ve retreated.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Weren’t worth it. Jamal nods in agreement.. He and Ryan both pull up their before they walk on. Eggsy doesn’t follow them -- he walk towards the curb instead, stops at a PARKED CAR.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Why you walking? It's freezing. He produces a set of CAR KEYS and starts to unlock the ca

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Who's car’s that? Eggsy gestures back towards the pub and grins.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: His, innit. Took the keys out his pocket when he come over.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Shit, son! The boys all explode into laughter and pile into the car. doors slam shut, Eggsy guns the engine and the gang burst of the pub just in time to see Eggsy pulling out.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG BOY
dialogues.text: You’re fucking dead! Eggsy throws him a “wanker” hand gesture as he tears away

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR/STREETS
dialogues.text: The car roars through the streets. Inside, the boys laugh uproariously.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Floor it, Egqgsy!

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: If they don’t: kill you, Dean will.  14 15 16 ll.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: The only person with the right to kill me is whoever actually paid for this car. Suddenly, A SIREN. FLASHING LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Did you have more than two pints?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Like that's my biggest problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy slams the car into reverse and guns into a side str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO COPS watch, incredulous and grudgingly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING COP
dialogues.text: Bloody hell.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTGUN COP
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Requesting back up --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR/SIDE STREET/ALLEY/STREET
dialogues.text: Eggsy roars backwards up the side street. Tension and excitement in the car now. Suddenly a SECOND FOLICE CAR looms into view. Eggsy turns sharply onto a PEDESTRIAN ALLEY.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Feds car can’t get down here. He’s absolutely right. The police car slows, then drives Inside, the boys laugh hysterically. Eggsy backs fast out of the alley, onto another street, a broad grin on his face, until: A FOX runs across the road Eggsy swerves to avoid it... And loses control. The car hurtles towards the pavement and hits a LAMP-POST.  17 18 19 12. SMOKE pours from under the hood. The first police car tur into the street, sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airbag has inflated. Eggsy struggles behind it, tryin get his seat-belt undone.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dickhead!

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Foxes are vermin, cuz! You should’ve driven it over! Eggsy'’s seat-belt is jammed. Outside, a second siren how

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: I should've done a lot of things. I'll sort this. Get out. {off their confused looks) I said get out. They do. As they run, Eggsy accelerates violently, SMASHI into the Police Car, giving his friends an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charming London mews. The camera cranes down to a copy TABLOID NEWSPAPER lying outside the front door of one hou The door opens and a hand picks it up. We jib up to revea Jack, now 49, sporting a beautiful tailored dressing gown He smiles as he reads the headline -- “BIKINI READY! KIM KARDASHIAN LOSES 15LBS” -- then shuts the door. INT. JACK’S HOUSE — DAY. 19 As we follow Jack inside, we realize that the mews house in fact, huge -~ the whole row has been knocked through. In Jack’s study area, a classic silver TEAPOT and bone Ch cup stands on his desk. The walls are covered in FRAMED TABLOID NEWSPAPER HEADLINES. Each more trivial than the l Jack discards his tabloid, settles at his computer and st to read the Financial Times online while sipping his tea. We track in to his wrist to see: a magnificent Dent WATCH thin that it looks painted on. Suddenly, the face glows r Jack presses a button on the watch and hastily gets up.  20 21 22 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The discreet, classy shop-front of a tailors shop on Lond Savile Row. The awning reads: “HUNTSMAN. ESTABLISHED 1849 Jack's classic Bristol CAR pulls up outside and Jack alig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of WELL-DRESSED TAILORS nod respectfully to Jack

dialogues.speaker: WELL-DRESSED TAILOR
dialogues.text: Arthur is in the dining room, six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, now late 60s, sits alone at a large table. He wea GLASSES. Before him: am exquisite DECANTER, a BRANDY SNIF and a leather bound FILE. There are twelve empty chairs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Galahad. Finally. The others were concerned that we may be making a double toast. There's another brandy at one seat. Jack sits down here a retrieves a pair of GLASSES like Arthur’s. He puts them o JACK'S POV: The previously empty seats are now occupied - TEN GENTLEMEN, wearing wonderful suits and identical glas Jack exchanges nods of greeting with them. Then his eyes alight on the single EMPTY SEAT. His face registers disma

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So I take it that it’s Lancelot we're drinking to.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Now we're all present... Gentlemen, I'm thankful to say that it’s been seventeen years since we last had occasion to use this decanter. And, as ever, the circumstances make even a 1815 Napoleonic brandy taste bitter. Lancelot was an outstanding agent and a true Huntsman, and he will be sorely missed. (vaising his glass) To Lancelot.  23 14. JACK'S POV: the other agents have brandy snifters too. Th raise them solemnly, then down the brandy in one.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To matters practical, before we disperse, One: Galahad will take over Lancelot:‘s current mission. Two: I intend to begin the selection process for Lancelot's replacement tomorrow. I expect each of you to propose a candidate and have them report to UK HQ no later than nine PM GMT. Thank you. JACK'S POV: The other agents acknowledge the order before removing their glasses. As they do, they disappear from v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy is sitting in front of A POLICEMAN and POLICEWOMAN, staring at a DOCUMENT that lies on the table between them

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I just wanna get this straight, right? If I sign this, and then I tell you who stole the truck with all them flat screen TV’s last month, you give me full immunity.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: That’s right. And the alternative is, you go down, And you’re looking at eighteen months. At least.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I can just walk right out of here? The officers nod. Eggsy smiles, signs the document and ha it over. The officers stare, waiting with baited breath.

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The person who stole the truck is... the person you’re looking at right now. (getting up) Nice doing business with you. The Policeman leaps up and slams Eggsy onto the desk.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh come on, bruv! A deal‘s a deal.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE MAN
dialogues.text: Doesn’t work like that. Nice try, though.  24 15.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE WOMAN
dialogues.text: You can give us hames, or we can just bin it. It’s up to you.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I wanna exercise my right to make a phonecall. The policeman lets go of him,

dialogues.speaker: POLICE MAN
dialogues.text: I hope it’s to your mum to say you're going to be eighteen months late for dinner. Eggsy reaches inside his tee-shirt for the gold chain he’ wearing. Hanging off it is the Guinevere Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur passes Jack the file. Jack opens it. Behind Arthur beautiful, ornate antique MIRROR transforms into: A SCREE

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Lancelot was investigating a group of mercenaries experimenting with biological weaponry. ON THE SCREEN: a horrific image of NAKED, BLOODIED AFRICA MEN. They appear to be trying to eat one another.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uganda, 2012. Synthetic cathinones.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Like bath salts? The street drug?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: They put it in the water supply at a guerilla army base... Rage... Cannibalism. Multiple fatalities. ON THE SCREEN: a room filled with bullet-riddled CORPSES.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chechnya, 2013. Insurgents turned on one another. Indisputably caused by our mercenaries. But this time, no trace of chemicals of any kind.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Unconnected with the first attack?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: All their attacks were unconnected. And none could be linked to any one political interest.  16.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well they are mercenaries... So, what happened to Lancelot?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I’m afraid this is where the story becomes a little... odd. On the screen: A photo of the high-security MOUNTAIN CHAL

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He tracked them to this property, in Argentina. And while he had them under surveillance, he became aware that they'd effected a kidnapping. He tried to execute a solo rescue mission. Failed. This was his last transmission... On the screen: words appear. “KIDNAP VICTIM IS PROFESSOR SWANSON.”

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Doesn’t sound especially odd. Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Some climate change doom-sayer. Expounds something called Gaia Theory. Overpopulation as a virus, earth trying to heal itself or some such. What’s curious is that he’s not actually missing. This is him. In London this morning. On the screen: a CCTV IMAGE OF THE PROFESSOR appears.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, it’s all yours. And don’t forget your membership proposal. Arthur slides the file to Jack, who stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nine PM at base. Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Try picking a more suitable candidate this time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (amused) Seventeen years... And still, evolving with the times remains an entirely foreign concept to you.  25 26 27 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With some uncertainty, Eggsy dials the number on the back the medal. It rings. Eggsy reacts in surprise and delight

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Customer complaints, how may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Ummm, my name is Eggsy Price and... Sorry, Chester Price. And I’m up shit creek. I’m in Camberwell police station and... My mum told me to call this number if I ever needed help. And... Yeah. I need help. So... Hello? You still there?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry sir, I think you have a wrong number,

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! Oxfords not bragues?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir. Please hold. Questionable lounge music plays down the phone. The longe Eggsy stays on hold, the more surreal this all seems to h

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thank you for holding, sir. Your complaint has been duly noted, and we hope that we have not lost you as a loyal customer. The line goes dead. Eggsy’s face falls. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman we saw before is filling in paperwork. The PHONE RINGS on his desk. He answers. Listens a moment. Th

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: You what??... I... Yes. Yes, I totally understand. He really doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It‘s raining. Eggsy exits. Jack igs outside, in his CAR.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Eggsy! Would you like a lift home?  28

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The man who got you released. INT. JACK’S CAR - DAY. Eggsy has never seen a car like this before.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Is this a kit car?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Its a Bristol. One of the finest examples of British engineering.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: So it’s shit, then.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s only seven minutes to your flat from here. Do you really want to spend it talking about my car?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: How do you know where I live?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: When are you going to ask me a more interesting question?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Alright, here's two. Who the fuck are you and how'd you get me out?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Badly phrased, but a good effort. My name is Jack Lincoln, I work for a London tailors called Huntsman and I gave you that cross. Your father saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: You were in the army? Like, an officer?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Never met anybody who knew my dad. ‘Cept my mum, obviously. Listen, can I buy you a drink, though? Like, to say thank you? 18. 28

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Splendid idea. They pull up outside the dodgy pub Eggsy was at last nigh Jack reaches into the back seat for an UMBRELLA.

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no... Not here. You won't like it, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nonsense. It says they have draught Guinness. What more can one ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pub is empty. Eggsy’s face floods with relief. At the bar, the BARMAN eyes Eggsy suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Two halves of Guinness.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (handing over a TENNER) Make it two pints, please.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Cheers. So, where were you posted, you and my dad? Iraq or something?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Eggsy. Classified.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I thought my mum had been on the erack pipe when she told me about the number. Feel guilty now. They take their drinks to a corner table. Jack downs half his Guinness. Eggsy sips his.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So. Want to know something about your dad? The day he died, I missed something. And if it weren't for your dad's courage, my mistake would have cost the lives of every Man present. So I owe him. He was a brave man. A good man. And having read your filles, I think he’d be bitterly disappointed in the choices you've made.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Whoa, hold the fuck up. You can’t just say shit about me like that!  20.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can and I will. Huge I9, great performance at primary school... Then it all went tits up. Drugs, petty crime, never had a job...

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Think there’s a lot of jobs going round here, do you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Doesn’t explain why you quit the paras. You were halfway through training. And doing brilliantly, I might add. But you gave up.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Because my mim went mental? Banging on about losing me as well as my dad. Didn't want me being cannon fodder for snobs like you. Judging people like me from your ivory towers with no thought about why we do what we do. We ain’t got much choice, you get me? And if we was born with the same silver spoon up our arses, we'd do just as well as you. If not better. Eggsy’s so worked up that he hasn’t even noticed that the Gang Boys have come in. And they’re looking right at him.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG BOY
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing here? You taking the piss? Eggsy leaps up. Jack doesn’t move. Eggsy tugs his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Some more examples of young men who simply need a silver suppository?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No, there are exceptions. Come on. Jack watches apathetically as the gang walk towards them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nonsense, we haven’t finished our drinks. The barman watches too, anxious. He’s not going to interv The gang reach Eggsy and Jack's table.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG BOY
dialogues.text: I told Dean what you done. He said that makes you fair game. He don't give a shit what your mum says.  21.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Listen, boys, I’ve had a really frustrating day. Whatever your beef with Eggsy is -- and I’m sure it's well-founded -- I'd appreciate it enormously iff you could just leave us in peace until I’ve finished this lovely pint of Guinness. The boys exchange incredulous looks.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANG BOY
dialogues.text: Better get out the way, grandad, or you're gonna get hurt and all.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: He ain't joking. You should go. A beat. Then Jack gets up, retrieves his umbrella and hea for the door.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG BOY
dialogues.text: You want another rent boy, they're on the cornex of Smith Street! The gang all LAUGH. Jack doesn’t react, keeps walking. He reaches the door... And bolts it shut. He turns back around to face them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Manners maketh the man. Do you know what that means? (off the stunned silence) Then let me teach you a lesson. Eggsy watches, staggered, as Jack approaches First Gang B

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well? Are we going to stand around all day or are we going to fight? The gang are just about. to erupt into shocked laughter w CRACK! Jack lands a mighty right hook, followed up by a s elbow to the jaw. The Hoy goes down like a sack of potato A beat -- disbelief -- then the rest of the gang rush Jac And there follows the most one-sided five-on-one fight we ever seen. Jack systematically beats the crap out of the remaining Gang Boys, using a breathtaking combination of exceptional fighting skills and incredible SPY GADGETS. Jack's UMBRELLA turns out to have a multitude of function Two boys have KNIVES - a MAGNET in Jack’s watch disarms t One boy grabs Jack's wrist to get the watch -- it gives h an electric shock.  30

At one point, Jack sees the Barman getting out his phone. Jack gets out his LIGHTER... Which releases a DART. The d flies into the man’s neck, and he collapses. In no time, all six gang boys are on the floor, out cold. Eggsy stares at Jack. Jack meets his eye, apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Needed to let off a little steam. Heard this morning that a friend of mine died. He knew your father, too, actually. Funny. Eggsy glances over with concern at the unconscious barman JACK (CON'T’D) He’ll be alright. Just a tranquilizer. With a little something thrown in to blank a couple of hours memory. Not terribly different to what they give you at the dentist. He pulls out his lighter again... and points it at Egqsy. Eggsy backs away, hands; held up defensively.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I do apolog. , Eggsy. I shouldn't have done this in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No, please! I won't say nothing, I swear! If there’s one thing I can do it’s keep my mouth shut. Ask the feds! I've never grassed anyone up!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You won’t tell a soul, is that a promise?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: On my life. Jack lowers the lighter and claps Eggsy on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Much appreciated, Eggsy. And you're right about the snobs. But there too, there are exceptions. Best of luck with everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Valentine, holding up a photograph of Lancelot. he sighs, puts it down. We can’t see who he’s talking to.  31 23.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE
dialogues.text: Great. You don‘t know, the CIA don’t know, no one knows who this guy is. Fine. Seriously, it’s fine. Well, it’s not actually fine. But it’s not why I’m here. He puts the photograph away in a briefcase, then leans in

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, you know me. Money has never been my issue. All I ever heard at Princeton was how lucky I was to inherit an oil fortune. So I went to MIT instead, and then my tech company is worth more than my oil company, knock myself off the Forbes top spot, yada yada. Point is, you know where the profit went. (a beat) Tried to save the planet. Climate change research, lobbying. Years of work. Billions of dollars. And you know why I quit? Because last time I checked, the planet was still screwed. So here’s my epiphany: money can’t solve this. The idiots who call themselves politicians have buried their heads in the sand, stood for nothing but re- election. The last two years, I've looked for a real solution. And I found it. And if you really want to make the world a better place, listen the hell up, very carefully, because I’m gonna tell it to you. We pull back to reveal that Valentine is in The Oval Offi talking to THE PRESIDENT.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Go on, Mr Valentine. As usual, I'm all ears. INT. EGGSY'S MUM’S FLAT - SUNSET. 31 Michelle and Dean are watching TV, Dean playing a game on Iphone, Michelle texting. Eggsy’s sister sleeps beside th The door opens and Eggsy enters. Michelle and Dean leap u

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Where the heil have you been?! Gone all night, all day, I've been worried sick, Mrs Joshi said -- She breaks off in shock as Dean punches Eggsy. Hard.  32 24.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dean! Dean proceeds to beat the crap out of Eggsy. Eggsy tries fight back, but Dean is huge. Michelle screams in protest

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth! I’ve had it with him. He needs to learn some respect. Winding up my business associates, nicking their car! (to Eggsy, punching him) And now your mate‘s gone and put four of ‘em in hospital. Who is he? Who was you with in the pub?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No one!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You're gonna fucking tell me or I’ll rip your head off, I swear. As Dean punches Eggsy again, we track past Dean’s fist... land on a tiny DOT on Eggsy‘s shoulder. Right where Jack patted him. We track in until darkness fills the screen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And track out again to reveal that we are now in Jack’ study. He’s hanging up a FRAMED NEWSPAPER HEADLINE beside others. “BIKINI READY! KIM KARDASHIAN LOSES 15LBS”. The s of Dean's assault is clearly audible in here.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dean, stop it! Eggsy, tell him!

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what he’s talking about, I wasn’t with no one! CRUNCH. The sound of another strike. Then Eggsy, GROANING Jack raises an eyebrow and walks calmly over to his desk. On Jack's computer we see FILES showing information on ha dozen YOUNG SOLDIERS. Jack closes them all. Now there’s j a MICROPHONE ICON and a SOUNDWAVE BOX, moving in synch wi the audio transmitted from Eggsy's home.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I could kill you, and the world wouldn’t even notice. Jack clicks on the microphone icon and leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But I would.  33 34 35 36 25. INT. EGGSY’S MUM'S FLAT! ~ SUNSET. 33 The assault is on hold. Dean, Michelle and Eggsy look aro baffled. Jack's voice is coming from every electronic ite

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I have enough evidence on your activities to have you locked away for the rest of your life, Mr. Dean Anthony Baker. So I suggest you leave the boy alone or I will be forced to deliver it to the appropriate authorities.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on? Taking advantage of Dean's confused state, Eggsy heaves himself to his feet and bolts for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And I suggest that from now on that you treat Michelle with the respect that she deserves. Over and out. The sound from the TV resumes. Dean gets up to examine it Michelle is glazed, in shock. What the hell just happened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy stands outside the closed store, peering in. Jack i inside, sitting on a sofa. Eggsy tries the door. It’s ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy looks around, out: of place. Jack stands to greet h

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Glad you made it. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huntsman’s lavish fitting room. There's a LIFE-SIZE WOODE HORSE in here. Jack steers Eggsy towards a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Someone who wants to know what the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I see a young man with potential. A young man who is loyai. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who can do as he’s asked. Who wants to do something good with his life. Did you see the movie Trading Places?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What about Nikita? The Dirty Dozen? (Eggsy shakes his head) Pretty Woman? (Eggsy looks affronted) Alright. My point is, the lack of a silver spoon has set you on a certain path. But you needn’t stay on it. If you're prepared to adapt, and learn, you can transform.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Like in My Fair Lady?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, you’re full of surprises. Yes. Like My fair Lady. Interested? (off Eggsy’s nod) Good. See that horse? Get on it.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Are you taking the piss? Jack doesn’t answer. Eqgsy climbs on, self-conscious. EGGSY (CONT’D) What's this for?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So that a gemtlemen can see how his new jacket hangs when mounted. Now give it a kick and say: “tally ho.”

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Fuck off! (off Jack's silence) "Tally ho.” (nothing happens) What does that do?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nothing, I just wanted to see how you were at following orders. (a beat) This, however... Jack smiles and pats the horse’s flank three times... And the room begins to SINK! Eggsy looks around in wonder  37 38 27.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: OBCK
dialogues.text: The finest tailors in London.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No, I mean... all this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Since 1849, Huntsman have clothed the world’s most powerful individuals. And at the close of World War One, the notion was conceived that the wealth and influence of our connections could be channeled for the greater good. The room stops moving. Jack motions for Eggsy to dismount Then he opens the door. On the other side is now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek chamber, like a mini subway platform. Eggsy boggl

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And so began our other venture. An independent, international intelligence agency operating at the highest level of discretion... Above the bureaucracy and politics that undermine the integrity of government-run spy organizations. Suddenly, NOISE. A capsule-like CARRIAGE shoots in. Stops door slides open. Jack steps in. Eggsy follows, mind blow T c. AGE - NIGHT. 38 There are four reclined seats inside. Jack and Eggsy sit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The suit is a modern gentleman’s armor, and the Huntsman agents are the new knights. Seatbelt? Eggsy fumbles with his belt as the carriage glides into t tunnel... And then they hurtle away at unfathomable speed

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's perfectly safe. Standard mag-lev system -- magnets. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our vacuum tunnel just makes it a little nippier. But it rarely goes above mach one. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: EQ. We’re recruiting a new member, and the selection process is about to begin. If you agree, I’d like to put you forward as my proposal. The carriage comes to a sudden stop. INT. SECRET BASE TERMINUS — NIGHT. 39 A much larger chamber, with a huge door at the end of it. Eggsy and Jack alight and head for the door. It opens ont

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast underground hangar. A Bondaholic’s wet dream. A BLENHEIM BOMBER and F2 FIGHTER hang from the vaulted ceil Eggsy can‘t believe his eyes as he follows Jack past one amazing thing after another: CARS, GADGETS, JET-—PACKS.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Before you make your mind up, there's something you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: As if I'm going to bail out now! He gestures around at all the cool stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your father tried out for membership of Huntsman. He was on his final field test when he died. This business isn’t without risks.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: You think I have anything to lose? Jack nods, a little wistfully. Understands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then let‘s get you signed in. INT. ;C_ ROOM - NIGHT. 4l Eggsy and Jack enter the rec room to see EIGHT YOUNG MEN THREE YOUNG WOMEN standing around, chattering excitedly.  29. Merlin is here, too. Mid 40s now, and even more handsome poised. He marks the CLIPBOARD he’s holding, smiles at Ja

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Galahad. Late again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Eggsy, explaining) My code name... Good Luck. Jack pats Eggsy on the shoulder and leaves, looking back a parent dropping his kid on the first day of kindergarde Eggsy hovers awkwardly, then gravitates over to the other

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Attention! Everyone leaps to attention. Eggsy is beside a small, mou American girl: ROXY, 22. She doesn’t take her eyes off Merlin, but discreetly pats Eggsy on the back, reassuring MERLIN (CONT’D) Ladies and Gentlemen, now we're all here: welcome. My name is Merlin. And you are about to embark upon what is arguably the most dangerous job interview in the world. Failure in any of the tests you’1l undergo over the coming weeks will mean you lose your chance at this job. But I need you to be aware that you could lose a great deal more. (gesturing to the wall) Can somebody tell me what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging up is: A BODY BAG. One man puts up his hand quickly. Aristocratic good looks well-groomed, supremely confident. This is CHARLIE, 23.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: A body bag, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Correct. Charlie, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Excellent. On the table, you will find a marker pen. Use it to write your name on the bag, plus contact details for your next of kin. And in a moment, the rest of you will collect your body bags from that closet over there, and you will do the same. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By doing so, you acknowledge the risks you face. You also acknowledge that you will never discuss your time here, even with your families. You break this rule, you put them at risk. {to Charlie) Well, what are you waiting for? Charlie breaks from the group and heads for the body bag.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why is this process so dangerous? Because the job you are competing for is a hundred times more so. If you're not up to it, we’d prefer to know now, and not later, when the lives of others may depend on it. Does anybody want out? The candidates’ eyes dart around the room. Anybody moving Eggsy's eyes meet Roxy’s. They both look away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you’re done with your bags, bed. The dorm is down the hall. Long day ahead tomorrow. Fall out! Merlin leaves the room and everyone hurries to the closet A tall attractive Danish blonde, AMELIA, 23, gets there f and starts passing out the bags to the first four in line ULRICH (macho, German), KENJI (slim, Japanese), ANTON (Burotrashy, Italian) and SABA (tough-looking, Ethiopian) At the back of the line, Roxy shakes Eggsy’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: Roxanne. But call me Roxy.

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: I’m Eggsy.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: Eggy?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No, Eggsy. Charlie, standing close by, done with his task, overhears

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Where did they dig you up?

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: You know we're not allowed to discuss who proposed us.  31. The boy in the line ahead of Roxy has been eves-dropping. This is HENRI -- 21, French, handsome, well-bred. He’s pe Charlie as the alpha male, and is keen to forge an allian

dialogues.speaker: HENRI
dialogues.text: No need to bite his head off. Charlie's only making conversation. That's right, Charlie, no? (shaking Eggsy’s hand) I’m Henri. Two more boys -- RUFUS (rugged, blonde, South African) an AJIT (good-looking, Indian) -- join the group. They've already got their bags. Rufus has two and hands one to He HENRI (CONT’D) Thank you. Guys, this is “Eggsy”. This is Rufus and Ajit. So, Eggsy, are you Oxford or Cambridge? Rufus and Ajit stifle a laugh. Charlie smirks, too.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Neither.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Harvard? The others grin. These four are really bonding now.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Wait, I think we may have met... Did you serve me at the McDonalds in Gatwick airport?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: No. But if I had, I’d’ve given you an extra helping of secret sauce. He mimes wanking onto a burger. There’s a silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Definitely Harvard. Henri, Rufus and Ajit explode into sycophantic laughter a head for the table with their bags.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY,
dialogues.text: Just ignore them. Amelia approaches, carrying the last three body bags. She hands one each to Roxy and Eggsy. ROXY (CONT’‘D) Thanks. Amelia, isn’t it? Amelia, Eggy.  42 32.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Hey Eggy. Don't take any notice of those guys.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: That's what I told him. A suave Persian boy hands Amelia the pen. This is OMAR.

dialogues.speaker: OMAR
dialogues.text: For you, bebe. Amelia smiles pleasantly and passes it to Eggsy instead. Roxy turns around, presents her back for Eggsy to use as writing surface and looks back seductively over her shoul

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: Here, use me,

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: She means to write on.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I know. He leans the bag on Roxy. He writes “EGGSY PRICE”. His ha shaking a little, he adds: "MOTHER: Michelle PRICE.”

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: It’s just scare tactics. Classic army technique. Nobody’s gonna die. Eggsy glances up at Rufus, Ajit and Henri, currently hoot with laughter at something Charlie has said.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same layout as the London dining room, only everythin Zaha Hadid-style modern. Jack and Arthur sit half-watchin SCREEN with a live feed of the rec room, the sound low.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Felt sorry for the boy, did you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Well you should now. He’ll find this humiliating. Still, at least you didn't propose a woman. I mean, what is going on? Jack indicates the screen, Charlie is holding court.  33.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Emm. And that:'s your proposal? Charlie, is it? All the right credentials besides having any understanding of the real world. He'll be a perfect replacement for you one day. Arthur mutes the sound from the screen completely.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I believe we're here to discuss new intelligence on the mercenaries?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Absolutely. The mountain property where Lancelot died was purchased eighteen months ago. The funds were transferred from a numbered account at the BGK bank in Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Then that’s as good as a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SINT. PRIVATE BANK
dialogues.text: ARTHUR -- younger here -- stands over a RUSSIAN BANK MANA a GUN to the man’s head. On the desk is a LIST OF NAMES.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'll ask you one more time: do any of the organizations on the list hold an account with you?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: We don't discuss our clients.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: This is your last chance. He readies the trigger. CLICK. The man doesn’t flinch.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: We don’t discuss our clients. Arthur holsters the gun, circles the desk and takes a sea

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Excellent. I'd like to open an account, please.  44a 45 46
INT. ARTHUR‘’S BASE OFFICE — NIGHT. 44 Arthur has just finished telling Jack this story.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: And that is why we bank with them, Not to mention that their fire-wall makes the KGB's look flimsy. You're looking at a physical break-in, and even that’s ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: To Moscow it is, then.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, SECRET BASE
dialogues.text: Jack exits. The base is huge, isolated, surrounded by woo There's an AIRSTRIP here, a beautiful BRISTOL JET on the runway. Jack strides towards it.

dialogues.speaker: . D
dialogues.text: A windowless army barrack-style dorm room with a WET ROOM area at one end -- HAND SHOWERS and TOILETS, all barely divided by low walls and barely concealed by a low BASIN COUNTER along the front. Privacy is going to be scarce. The recruits enter. All but Eggsy have SUITCASES. They st to the beds. Amelia, Saba and Roxy bag beds up one end.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oooh. All the girls together. Planning a little action?

dialogues.speaker: ROKY
dialogues.text: Why, do you need some tips? Eggsy finds one bed left, between Roxy and Anton. Anton unfolds a VELVET GARMENT, puzzled. There's one on every b Eggsy unfolds his. It's a VELVET JUMPSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What the hell is this??

dialogues.speaker: OMAR
dialogues.text: Regulation gear, I guess? But why velvet? So heavy!

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: And hot.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The Siren jumpsuit. Winston Churchill designed it for himself. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not that I’d expect you foreigners to know.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I’m English.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t even talking to you. I think it goes without saying that you wouldn't. Eggsy’s discomfort increases as everyone starts changing bed. Not only is he without a case, but everyone seems entirely relaxed about undressing in front of one another Especially Roxy. She removes everything but her briefs, a starts casually rummaging in her case. She looks to Eggsy

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: Where’s your stuff?

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: No one told me to bring anything.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: That sucks. Wanna borrow something to sleep in? She throws him a tee-shirt and smiles at him warmly. He smiles back, grateful, but trying to avert his eyes. Suddenly, the lights turn off. There’s a collective GROAN

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Looks like it's bedtime. Everyone climbs into bed. Eggsy lies staring into the darkness for a while before closing his eyes. INT. MERLIN’S OFFICE - NIGHT. 47 Merlin puts on his glasses and settles at his computer. O the monitor are: BLUEPRINTS for a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beautifully panelled and upholstered interior of the Jack sits alone, sipping a drink. His watch FLASHES. He s on his glasses and looks over to an empty seat. JACK'S POV: Merlin is now sitting in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Arthur instructed me to brief you on infiltrating the GBK mainframe.  49 36.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Fire away. Under Merlin’s V.0., we now see the mission plan playing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The GBK bank building. WELL-DRESSED RUSSIANS enter. On a TALL WOMAN -- fur coat, gloves, large pricey HANDBAG.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The bank opens at eight AM. The ladies’ is on the sixth floor. -- The woman enters a beautifully—appointed elevator. -- In a TOILET CUBICLE, she looks up at: an AIR VENT.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The vent is above the last cubicle. The shaft will take you as far as the East fire escape. -- She removes her coat to reveal a fitted black sweater ski pants... and a rather manly body. Then she tears off we now realize is A WIG, and A LATEX MASK. This is JACK. -- He climbs into up the ventilation shaft, crawls along. -- He drops silently from a ceiling vent and races upstai

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The vault is two floors up... On the north side of the building. -- On a landing, Jack applies a thick layer of PURPLE RES to his palms. Then opens the window here and climbs out. -~ He inches toward the corner of the building, the myste resin somehow making his palms adhere to the masonry.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The security corridor is unmanned until eight fifteen AM... But the laser field will be active. Your access point will be three point two metres firom the end. -- Jack slips in through a window. LASER BEAMS crisscross corridor, a-la Oceans 12/Entrapment. He expertly negotiat his way down it, leaping, ducking, slithering. Impressive stops in the middle and gets a GADGET out of his bag. -- In a stark SERVER ROOM, a HOLE is cut into the ceiling A CLAMP bites the hole. A CABLE is looped through the cla  50

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You'll have five minutes. Get in, get the info, get out. Jack drops down, now improbably wearing a harness. He sto neatly above a computer and begins to tap at the keyboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks to the holographic Merlin, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That sounds exhausting.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Do you have a better plan?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I do. Merlin shrugs. Then he looks at his watch. And VANISHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggsy is asleep. Suddenly: a GRINDING NOISE. His eyes ope Above him, the ceiling of the dorm room is scrolling open like a car sun-roof. It moves a couple of feet, then stop A split second later: a tidal wave of WATER explodes thro the gap and CRASHES into the room! Everyone scrambles out of bed. The water is already knee on the floor and still sluicing down from above.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s a test! Look for a way out! Henri, closest to the door, lunges for the handle, strugg

dialogues.speaker: HENRI
dialogues.text: It's locked!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s the pressure, pull harder. Rufus and Ajit join Henri in pulling the door, while Amel Omar, Anton and Saba move to the walls, pounding them.

dialogues.speaker: KENJI
dialogues.text: The floor! Look under the beds! Kenji dives under water. Ulrich follows. Roxy climbs onto her bed, which is situated under the ope part of the ceiling, under the gushing waterfall.  38.

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: There’s no other opening! We've got to go through it! Give me a leg up! Eggsy climbs onto her bed and complies, but as Roxy moves into the flow, she is wiolently thrown back by the force. And they both fall, landing in the now waist~high water. As she swims away, fighting the current, Eggsy looks arou assessing his next move. He sees: Charlie, by the showers

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Roxy! Amelia! Try the bathroom! But they can't hear him over the gushing water. Eggsy swi over. Charlie is trying to rip a HAND-SHOWER off the wall EGGSY (CONT‘D) Breathing tube?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: In the loo! It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: The loo?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Toilet. Lavvy. Shitter. Whatever you chavs call it.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: I know what one is, I meant -- The shower comes away. Charlie hastily unscrews the head.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stick this in it, go past the U- bend: limitless air supply. Simple physics. Spread the word. Charlie smugly dives under water. Eggsy yells to the grou

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Grab a showex, shove it in the bog! Everyone swims over, fast. Eggsy tears a SHOWER from the wall, unscrews the heacl and hands it to Roxy and Amelia.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll have to share, take it in turns to breathe! The others get to work pulling the remaining hand showers from the wall, then diving under the water with their hos Eggsy doesn’t have one. The water is nearing the ceiling He takes a deep breath and dives under.  52 39. UNDERWATER: Eggsy swims for the toilets. Everyone is clustered there, taking turns to breathe. Charlie and Hen share a hose. Eggsy taps Charlie, desperate for air. Char makes a shooing motion, passes it to Henri instead. Eggsy swims up to the surface. There’s only an inch of ai the ceiling now. He takes a last, desperate gasp before t water finally rises again, and there is no air left. Eggsy panics. He’s running out of breath when he glimpses reflection in the MIRROR running along the side wall. A F of light catches his eye. He swims towards the mirror. Eggsy touches his fingertips to it. An odd double-reflect Eggsy's eyes widen. And we pull back, through the mirror, see: it’s a two way mirror. The dorm is a giant tank, bui in cavernous OBSERVATICN ROOM. Merlin is in here, watchin With all the strength he can muster, Eggsy RIPS a BASIN f and heaves it at the mirror. And again. Until it SHATTERS Water floods through into the Observation Room, creating powerful current that drags the candidates...

dialogues.speaker: INT, OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: .-.And washes them out of the dorm, onto the floor of the observation room, gasping like fish from a broken fish ta Merlin surveys the group.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Congratulations to all of you on completing your first test. And in particular, to Charlie... And Eggsy. Who it seems has some experience with two-way mirrors. (off Charlie’s proud grin) I'd wipe that smirk off your face if I were you, and show some respect. Not everybody passed. Eggsy follows his gaze, and reacts in dismay. Amelia is still in the dorm, lying in a corner. Motionles

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Training begins tomorrow, which I will have nothing to do with. Watching people train is boring. When you see me, it means there's a test. Your real dormitory is across the hall. Get some sleep. They leave in somber silence. Eggsy last, glancing back a Amelia in disbelief. And TWO MEN enter, carrying her body  53 54 55 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expensively furnished living-room. TWO CHILDREN in expensive clothes squeal with delight as a clown wearing up and a carnival mask finishes an elaborate BALLOON LION May or may not recognise the clown immediately as Jack. He passes it to the smaller child, who bounces happily, a then talks gently to the other child in Russian, subtitle

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What animal would you like?

dialogues.speaker: CHILD
dialogues.text: Penguin!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Penguin! My favorite!

dialogues.speaker: SMALLER CHILD
dialogues.text: Lion is my favourite! Nanny, look! We pull further back to see a young Russian NANNY sitting nearby. She doesn’t look happy. She stares at: Jack's belt. The handle of a GUN is clearly visible.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shall we show Daddy? Hold it up to my little camera, he can see it. He points to a FLOWER in his lapel. The children giggle.

dialogues.speaker: CHILD
dialogues.text: That’s not a camera, silly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian Bank Manager from Arthur’s flashback is at hi desk, sweating. On his computer, two windows are open -- data, the other live video of his kids and Jack-the-clown

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: I’ve got it! I’ve got it. Okay. I'm sending it now to the file drop you gave me. And you will leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack glances at his watch. It flashes. Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yup. Just finishing a penguin. A few more twists, and he hands it to the delighted child  56 41. JACK (CONT’D) (in Russian, subtitled) I have to go. Lovely to meet you! Jack stands and walks away, waving cheerfully as he leave to loud “awww"s of protest from the children. EXT. SECRET BASE - TRAINING AREA — DAY. 56 The recruits (in jumpsuits) follow Merlin past an ASSAULT COURSE, to a row of KENNELS containing PUPPIES of all bre

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: As some of you learned last night, team work is paramount at Huntsman. But I need you all to learn that. Before we do the assault course, you're each going to pick a puppy. He gestures to them to approach the pens. We follow Eggsy down the row of eager puppy faces. A tiny PUG cocks its h

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: From here on in, wherever you go, your dog goes. You will care for it. You will train it. Your dog is your responsibility at all times. Choose your puppy. A CLATTER of cage doors, BARKING. Charlie, Henri, Rufus a Ajit bag the service breeds: LABRADOR, COLLIE, ALSATIAN. Panicking, Eggsy grabs the pug. Roxy grabs a STANDARD POO

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: A poodle?

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: What? They're gun dogs. Oldest working breed. Easy to train. (looking at his dog) A pug?

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: It’s a bulldog, innit? (off her head-shake) It'll get bigger, though, won’t it? (another head-shake) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Attention! Everyone stands to attention, dogs running around their f

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The last candidate to complete the course goes home. GO!  57 42. Everyone rushes for the assault course. Eggsy looks down. then back to the kennels: his dog is still there. Lying d Charlie, Henri, Rufus and Ajit leap onto the first obstac YELLING instructions. Their dogs race off in every direct Charlie catches his, smacks it on the muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No! Bad. Stay. Roxy, Kenji, Ulrich, Saba, Omar and Anton show more patie coaxing their dogs gently. But it’s anarchy. Suddenly, th all turn to stare at something... Eggsy is approaching in a classic slow movie power walk o heroic determination. The Right Stuff. Armageddon. Reserv Dogs. Only slightly undercut by the little pug head pokin out of the collar of Eqgsy’s shirt. Eggsy leaps onto the first obstacle. Hand’s free, it’s ea He continues, passing all the other recruits. Forges ahea Charlie, Henri, Rufus and Ajit try fruitlessly to copy hi Henri tries to stuff his wriggling Doberman into his shir Charlie has his shirt off and is trying to tie his Alsati to his back in a papoose. It scrabbles unhappily. CHARLIE (CONT’D) Christ! I swear, if this bastard scratches me again... Eggsy continues around the course, perfectly focussed. Th pug looks about as happy as a pug ever can. Across the field, Ajit chases after his escaping Labrador At the last obstacle, Merlin waits with a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Arthur are at the table.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The name on the account is fake. It’s entirely untraceable.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No surprise there. What else?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Multiple regular payments to the mercenaries. Again, no surprise. But there were a lot of other rather large recent payments to individuals. Rather prominent individuals. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Scientists, doctors, academics, artists, authors. A few of them quite well known.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: How bizarre.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That wasn’t even the most surprising discovery. That would have to be the very large payment made to Professor Alan Swanson.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You mean fromm Professor Swanson. Ransom money.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is asleep. Their dogs sleep too, in training cra at the end of each bed. One crate is empty, and the bed behind it - Ajit’s bed - is empty as well, and stripped b The crate at the end of Eggsy’s bed is also empty, But Eggsy’s dog is asleep, curled up on the bed. Suddenly: WATER rains down on Eggsy! He sits up, terrifie not again!! Charlie is running away with an empty BUCKET. Henri, Rufu Ulrich, Omar and Kenji practically wet themselves laughin Eggsy leaps up and runs at Charlie, livid. In a flash, Ro is out of bed. She pulls Eggsy away.

dialogues.speaker: ROKY
dialogues.text: Eggsy, forget it. Seriously. You'll get thrown out. It's not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s worth it to me! Maybe I don't care if I get kicked out!

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: But maybe I care. Maybe I want a little bit of real competition, here. If you’re gone: way too easy. Her jokey bragging makes him smile. He lets her push him to his bed. His expression turns serious now. He whispers

dialogues.speaker: EGGSY
dialogues.text: Why are you being nice to me?  59 60

dialogues.speaker: ROXY
dialogues.text: Because I'm nice. And because ten years ago, I'd have been the one getting ostracized. (seeing his blank look) Made to feel different. Just for having a vagina.

dialogues.speaker: EGSSY
dialogues.text: Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: ROXKY
dialogues.text: I didn't mean you have a vagina. That came out wrong. They both laugh. Eggsy climbs into his bed, feeling bette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful courtyard on the historic campus. Establishin INT. PROFESSOR SWANSON'’S OFFICE - DAY. 60 Swanson is wearing a BLUE-TOOTH EAR-PIECE, carrying a CUP TEA, as he enters. He drops the tea in shock as he sees: Jack. Sitting calmly in an armchair.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Who are you? Get out! Jack leaps up, grabs him by the collar. Swanson WHIMPERS.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My colleague died trying to rescue you and I‘m sure you saw how well trained he was. So I suggest you tell me who kidnapped you and why they paid you to keep it quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SWANSON
dialogues.text: Excuse me?? T have no idea what you're talking about. Now please -—- Jack slaps him. Swanson starts to scream.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Man up, I barely touched you! Christ's sake, I didn’t even -- Suddenly, Professor Swanson’s head SPONTANEOUSLY EXPLODES Literally. We’re talking Scanners, here. Jack is thrown b The back window SHATTERS and TWO ARMED THUGS burst in. They open fire as Jack drags himself to the front window behind him and hurls himself through it.  61 62 63 64 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lies on the ground. It wasn’t the longest fall, but not in a good way. He‘s not getting up right now. With his last energy, he grabs his CUFF-LINK and squeezes INT. PROFESSOR SWANSON’S OFFICE - DAY. 62 There's an elegant CIGARETTE LIGHTER on the floor. The thugs are running to the broken window, taking aim, w WOOF! The lighter EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAME billows from the broken window. Other windows blow Jack tries to get up, but he’s blacking out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh bugger. He presses his watch and collapses. 3NT. VALENTINE’S HO - DAY. 64 Valentine is pacing angrily. Gazelle sits at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE
dialogues.text: Sounded like an explosion. Did our guys have explosives? (off his head shake) Great. Fuck! Fuck that guy. Whoever he is, I’m gonna... He made me kill Professor Swanson! I goddamn loved Professor Swanson.

dialogues.speaker: GAZELLE
dialogues.text: Good news is, we know the emergency and surveillance systems work.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE
dialogues.text: Know what’s not good? “my colleague died”. You heard the guy. This is an organization, and they’re all over us. Whoever you spoke to --

dialogues.speaker: GAZELLE
dialogues.text: I told you, I made contact with the KGB, M16, Mossad and Beijing. They all insist he wasn’t one of theirs.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE
dialogues.text: Beijing. It’s so freaky how there’s no recognizable name for the Chinese secret service. Now, that’s what you call secret, right?! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mercurial, he darkens) Keep looking. I’m sitting here waiting to push the button on phase two. It's way late to be doubting who we can trust. (a beat) Not happy, Gazelle. Not even a bit happy- Know what? Fuck it. We’re gonna need to speed things up. Bring the product release forward.

dialogues.speaker: GAZELLE
dialogues.text: We're only halfway into production, Speeding it up will cost a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE
dialogues.text: Like I care! Just get it done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TABLE here bears PISTOLS and WEBBING. Also, incongruous colorful HELIUM ANIMAL BALLOONS. Merlin picks up a PISTOL

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: This is our standard issue pistol, made for us by Purdey and Sons of London. As you see, it also fires a shotgun cartridge for messy short- range situations. Please note that today you won’t use that function. Take a gun, webbing, and two balloons. And leave your dogs here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAZE -- like a laser-tag scenario, but much more elabor The candidates follow Merlin in, wearing the webbing. Eac has two balloons tied to them, floating above their heads

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Shoot other people’s balloons. First to lose both is out. As is anyone who hits a person. And by “out”, I mean going home.

dialogues.speaker: SABA
dialogues.text: Wait... These are real bullets.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Well spotted, Saba. Now, on the first signal, scatter. On the second, the hunt is on. A KLAXON sounds and the candidates race for the labyrinth Balloons bob above the walls. Eggsy ducks as low as he ca  67 Al. Charlie and Henri creep together, in some kind of truce. Ulrich climbs up into a small TOWER structure. A SECOND KLAXON sounds. Then there is silence. POP! One of Eggsy's balloons bursts. POP! Roxy loses one Up in the tower, Ulrich is taking pot shots at everyone.. But now he’s the prime target. From their various locatio every candidate now has his or her sights trained on Ulri Everyone fires. POP! POP! Both of Ulrich’s balloons go... Then he is HIT in the chest. He FALLS from the tower. ANOTHER KLAXON sounds. It’s over. Everyone runs over to w Ulrich is lying, groaning. Merlin approaches, too.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Medic! We need a medic!

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: No we don’t. Unlike Churchill’s jumpsuits, ours have Kevlar woven into them. The fall probably hurt more than the shot. Just as well you were the first to lose both balloons, Ulxich. You can recuperate at home instead of our sick bay. And Anton? That was your bullet, so pack your bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dgack is in a sick bay bed. Merlin is here, and they’re watching a screen playing footage of Professor Swanson’s exploding, in super-slow motion, on a loop.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: You felt heat?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Heat. Yes. But mostly pain.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with pyroclastic density currents?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Something to do with volcanoes?

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Exactly. Superheated gas and matter. Stand downwind in the wrong conditions and your brain can cook fast enough to shatter the skull.  48.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Right. Only there was no superheated gas and matter. Just an unoccupied room with a very agitated academic in it.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: I’m told even academics contain fluid and soft tissue. Question is, how did it get superheated? Arthur enters.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: How are we? Shaken and stirred?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Never been better.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Four broken ribs, multiple lacerations and concussion. Needs to stay at least forty eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Still significantly healthier than poor old Professor Swanson. Who perished in a tragic gas leak, by the way. There was talk of an autopsy, but I dealt with it. So, what do we have? (looking at the screen) Good grief. On the screen, Swanson’s head slowly explodes again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I ran a communications trace. The Prof received a blank text to his mobile. Just before his head blew. Merlin touches the screen. The video freezes. It’s at an especially amazing moment in the earliest stage of explos Merlin points to the blue-tooth earpiece Swanson is weari

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Swanson's phone earpiece. Rigged to deliver intense heat directly into the ear canal. Triggered by a text.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's trace that text. ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large venue somewhere in coastal Italy. ELTON JOHN is j finishing a performance on stage. The huge CROWD going wi  69 70 7 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the stage door, a LIMO waits. Elton John forges toward through a crowd of FANS, assisted by TWO VENUE SECURITY G

dialogues.speaker: INT, LIMOSUINE
dialogues.text: Elton gets in and the car pulls away. Now, his eyes widen Gazelle is sitting opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?! (seeing Gazelle’s legs) Sorry, but this is my fucking car -- {to the driver) Stop! Driver! Stop! Parlo Inglese?! Fucking stop!

dialogues.speaker: GAZELLE
dialogues.text: No need. My boss is staying at a Villa just along the coast. He's dying to meet you. Elton is about to unleash hell, then he sees Gazelle’s GU

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Oh fucking hell. I’m going to fucking die now, aren't I? Gazelle takes a bottle of SODA from the ice bucket.

dialogues.speaker: GAZELLE
dialogues.text: No way. My boss adores you. Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three empty beds in here now, the mattresses bare. Eggsy on his bed, exhausted, playing with his dog. Everyone els playing charades. Roxy's up.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
